name: Colonial Conquest
description: Colonial Conquest is a conquest simulation set in the Victorian age of warfare and expansion of the late 1800's and early 1900's.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7/8 Processor: 2.5 GHz Intel Dual Core Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: 512 MB NVIDIA GeForce 9600 DirectX: Version 9.0c Storage: 500 MB available space

reviews.review_text: Very suprised by this game, quick, simple and a blast to play. I would say that some portions of the user interface do not seem to work or are hard to navigate. When I went to look up the rules etc. the links didn't seem to work.  Overall a really fun game. JUST ONE MORE TURN!   EDIT: The links work now and I can look up rules etc. Still overall UI/UX could use some work, but I'm having a lot of fun.

Thanks for a new and addictive vector to sink my already limited free time. I have yet to explore all of the game but I have enjoyed myself thoroughly. I am positively surprised in feeling that this is a game I enjoy not only because of older memories but rather on its own merits.  Thanks for the super quick first batch of bug-hunting and fixing. Keep up the good work guys.
not that deep but very funny for beginners and /or people who dont have that much time to play.
OMG!!! You can play as the German Empire before WW1!   Rating: 90000000/10

I'm too tired to write an actual grammatical review, so have some pros and cons of this game.  PROS: -Looks nice -Simple to learn -Really cool art  CONS: -Horrible turn phase -Turns split into seasons, and you can only do anything in spring -Constant crashes -Buggy as hell -AI has information advantage -The only source of information you have is through espinage -You constantly find 1000 unit stacks in certain places (Which I think is involed with the AI using the Economic help mechanic) -Stupid combat mechanics -And again, buggy as hell  I'm so ♥♥♥♥ing done...
I had issues wth the game but the dev reached out to me personally and addressed my concerns. I am impressed.

This game crash randomly. And you have to create a new game. Well seriously I love strat games.. But the gameplay is 'low', there is no Austrian Empire or Italian Kingdom, and it's bugged.  ACTUALLY - 18/02/2016 - I just received my refund. I'll wait 'bug fixe' and buy it at -95% and no more.

I don't like the way there's no real tutorial and the help option opens a web browser in steam overlay and navigates to an online page with the rules on.  Even beyond that the game is just more simplistic than I thought it would be. If I hadn't bought this on a web store I would have been refunding this on steam.  It's sad to think that someone backed the kickstarter for this at the $1000 level and two people at the $2500 level.

A Great game, but I suggest you not get it. It wouldnt be worth the $10 price, I would wait for a sale. Everything about it is good, its just there isnt much content. I cant give too much detail because I only played one gamemode.
